DataElement.preferredName: Exclusion Criteria Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Observation Performed Study Activity Not Reason ISO21090.DSET.SC.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A characteristic or requirement that disqualifies a subject from participation in a study. EXAMPLE(S): pregnancy The text and/or code that describes why an activity did not occur. EXAMPLE(S): forgot to ask, sample lost.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Exclusion Criteria Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Observation Performed Study Activity Not Reason
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective; the state of being active._Not; used for negation of a word or group of words.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Exclusion Criteria Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Observation Performed Study Activity
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective; the state of being active.

Concepts.definition: Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.
Watching something and taking note of what happens.
Executed and carried through to completion.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: Not; used for negation of a word or group of words.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A collection containing unordered distinct/discrete values of the type SC.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
